intro: Geitonoplesium cymosum, commonly known as the Christmas cherry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
